alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 18 at 3:15PM EDT until April 19 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Sullivan county. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Heavy, wet snow could lead to scattered power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be highly elevation dependent, with the heaviest totals across the higher terrain. Snow may change to a wintry mix or even entirely to rain after midnight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
